page.title: 17Farming in Saxilby Area
page.content: Nearly the whole Saxilby area given over to agriculture is arable, mostly wheat, with barley, oilseed rape, peas, beans, and sugar beet also being grown. There are no uncultivated areas . Partly due to Government policies, the number of animals has reduced, esp dairy herds. There is only 1 dairy unit, 1 pig unit and a few beef cattle. Three farming companies own the largest acreage and there are seven individual farmers. Each one has his own machinery to drill, plough, spray, and harvest. Some cultivating and aerial spraying is contracted out. 1985 has been one of the wettest harvests on record. There is also a seed trial unit where flower and vegetable seeds are tested and experiments on composts are carried out. There is a commercial nursery unit with glass houses.
